t: Job 34
Elihu Proclaims God’s Justice
Elihu*p further answered and said:
“Hear*pn my words, you wise men;*i Give*ld ear to me, you who have knowledge.
For*ld the ear tests words As*ld the palate tastes food.
Let*ld us choose justice for ourselves; Let*ld us know among ourselves what is*i good.
“For*ln Job has said, ‘I am righteous, But*ld God has taken away my justice;
Should*ld I lie concerning my right? My*ld wound is*i incurable, though*i I*i am*i without transgression.’
What*ld man is*i like Job, Who*ild drinks scorn like water,
Who*ld goes in company with the workers of iniquity, And*ld walks with wicked men?
For*ld he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing That*ld he should delight in God.’
“Therefore*ln listen to me, you men of understanding: Far*ld be it from God to*i do*i wickedness, And*ld from*i the Almighty to commit*i iniquity.
For*ld He repays man according*i to*i his work, And*ld makes man to find a reward according to his*i way.
Surely*ld God will never do wickedly, Nor*ld will the Almighty pervert justice.
Who*ld gave Him charge over the earth? Or*ld who appointed Him*i over*i the whole world?
If*ld He should set His heart on it, If*ild He should gather to Himself His Spirit and His breath,
All*ld flesh would perish together, And*ld man would return to dust.
“If*ln you*i have*i understanding, hear this; Listen*ld to the sound of my words:
Should*ld one who hates justice govern? Will*ld you condemn Him*i who*i is*i most just?
Is*ild it*i fitting*i to say to a king, ‘You*i are*i worthless,’ And*ild to nobles, ‘You*i are*i wicked’?
Yet*ld He is not partial to princes, Nor*ld does He regard the rich more than the poor; For*ld they are*i all the work of His hands.
In*ld a moment they die, in the middle of the night; The*ld people are shaken and pass away; The*ld mighty are taken away without a hand.
“For*ln His eyes are*i on the ways of man, And*ld He sees all his steps.
There*ld is no darkness nor shadow of death Where*ld the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
For*ld He need not further consider a man, That*ld he should go before God in judgment.
He*ld breaks in pieces mighty men without inquiry, And*ld sets others in their place.
Therefore*ld He knows their works; He*ld overthrows them*i in the night, And*ld they are crushed.
He*ld strikes them as wicked men*i In*ld the open sight of others,
Because*ld they turned back from Him, And*ld would not consider any of His ways,
So*ld that they caused the cry of the poor to come to Him; For*ld He hears the cry of the afflicted.
When*ld He gives quietness, who then can make trouble? And*ld when He hides His*i face, who then can see Him, Whether*ld it*i is*i against a nation or a man alone?—
That*ld the hypocrite should not reign, Lest*ld the people be ensnared.
“For*ln has anyone*i said to God, ‘I*ld have borne chastening;*i I*ld will offend no more;
Teach*ld me what*i I do not see; If*ld I have done iniquity, I will do no more’?
Should*ld He repay it*i according to your terms,*i Just*ild because you disavow it? You*ld must choose, and not I; Therefore*ld speak what you know.
“Men*ln of understanding say to me, Wise*ld men who listen to me:
‘Job*ld speaks without knowledge, His*ld words are*i without wisdom.’
Oh,*ld that Job were tried to the utmost, Because*ld his*i answers are*i like*i those of wicked men!
For*ld he adds rebellion to his sin; He*ld claps his*i hands*i among us, And*ld multiplies his words against God.”
